verses.verse: A Psalm <S%H4210><s%> of Asaph. <S%H623><s%> O God, <S%H430><s%> the heathen <S%H1471><s%> are come <S%H935><s%> into your inheritance; <S%H5159><s%> your holy <S%H6944><s%> temple <S%H1964><s%> have they defiled; <S%H2930><s%> they have laid <S%H7760><s%> Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> on heaps. <S%H5856><s%>

The dead <S%H5038><s%> bodies <S%H5038><s%> of your servants <S%H5650><s%> have they given <S%H5414><s%> to be meat <S%H3978><s%> to the fowls <S%H5775><s%> of the heaven, <S%H8064><s%> the flesh <S%H1320><s%> of your saints <S%H2623><s%> to the beasts <S%H2416><s%> of the earth. <S%H776><s%>
Their blood <S%H1818><s%> have they shed <S%H8210><s%> like water <S%H4325><s%> round <S%H5439><s%> about Jerusalem; <S%H3389><s%> and there was none <S%H369><s%> to bury <S%H6912><s%> them.
We are become <S%H1961><s%> a reproach <S%H2781><s%> to our neighbors, <S%H7934><s%> a scorn <S%H3933><s%> and derision <S%H7047><s%> to them that are round <S%H5439><s%> about us.
How <S%H5704><s%> long, <S%H5704><s%> LORD? <S%H3068><s%> will you be angry <S%H599><s%> for ever? <S%H5331><s%> shall your jealousy <S%H7068><s%> burn <S%H1197><s%> like fire? <S%H784><s%>

Pour <S%H8210><s%> out your wrath <S%H2534><s%> on the heathen <S%H1471><s%> that have not known <S%H3045><s%> you, and on the kingdoms <S%H4467><s%> that have not called <S%H7121><s%> on your name. <S%H8034><s%>
For they have devoured <S%H398><s%> Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> and laid waste <S%H8074><s%> his dwelling <S%H5116><s%> place.

O remember <S%H2142><s%> not against us former <S%H7223><s%> iniquities: <S%H5771><s%> let your tender mercies <S%H7356><s%> speedily <S%H4118><s%> prevent <S%H6923><s%> us: for we are brought <S%H1809><s%> very <S%H3966><s%> low. <S%H1809><s%>

Help <S%H5826><s%> us, O God <S%H430><s%> of our salvation, <S%H3468><s%> for the glory <S%H3519><s%> of your name: <S%H8034><s%> and deliver <S%H5337><s%> us, and purge <S%H3722><s%> away our sins, <S%H2403><s%> for your name's <S%H8034><s%> sake. <S%H4616><s%>

Why <S%H4100><s%> should the heathen <S%H1471><s%> say, <S%H559><s%> Where <S%H346><s%> is their God? <S%H430><s%> let him be known <S%H3045><s%> among the heathen <S%H1471><s%> in our sight <S%H5869><s%> by the revenging <S%H5360><s%> of the blood <S%H1818><s%> of your servants <S%H5650><s%> which is shed. <S%H8210><s%>

Let the sighing <S%H603><s%> of the prisoner <S%H616><s%> come <S%H935><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> you; according to the greatness <S%H1433><s%> of your power <S%H2220><s%> preserve <S%H3498><s%> you those that are appointed <S%H1121><s%> to die; <S%H8546><s%>

And render <S%H7725><s%> to our neighbors <S%H7934><s%> sevenfold <S%H7659><s%> into <S%H413><s%> their bosom <S%H2436><s%> their reproach, <S%H2781><s%> with which <S%H834><s%> they have reproached <S%H2778><s%> you, O Lord. <S%H136><s%>

So we your people <S%H5971><s%> and sheep <S%H6629><s%> of your pasture <S%H4830><s%> will give you thanks <S%H3034><s%> for ever: <S%H5769><s%> we will show <S%H5608><s%> forth <S%H5608><s%> your praise <S%H8416><s%> to all generations. <S%H1755><s%>
